channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: On the bus lane in front of 234 kilburn high road, 17th September
item.description:
There's a significant pothole in the middle of the bus lane. It's about 40 cm long and 10 cm wide at its center, with a depth of 15 cm. The edges are sharp and uneven, posing a clear hazard to cyclists and vehicles. This isn't the first incident linked to this pothole, and it continues to be a major safety concern.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn High Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Eyesore & public health concern: Abandoned house and adjacent abandoned building project, 17th September
item.description:
I am writing to formally raise concerns regarding a property on Blandford Road which has been a persistent issue for residents for at least the past two years. The owner of this dwelling obtained planning permission to erect a new property on the land. Initially, construction moved quickly and the shell of the house was built. However, work abruptly ceased, and since then the site has become increasingly problematic. Firstly, rubbish began to accumulate outside the property. At one point, squatters moved in and were only removed after residents reported this to the owner. Following that, the site was secured with hoardings and a skip was placed in front of the property. Regrettably, for well over a year now no further work has been undertaken, and the skip has become a dumping ground. Household waste, food packaging, broken furniture, and fly-tipped materials are now accumulating to an unacceptable degree. Despite repeated assurances and excuses from the absent owner, no meaningful action has been taken to address this situation. Residents who have raised concerns directly have often been ignored or, in some cases, verbally abused. The neglect of this property is creating an unsanitary and unpleasant environment, and it is having a negative impact on the overall character and wellbeing of the neighbourhood. Whilst we appreciate this is a private property, its current state is entirely unacceptable and is now a matter that warrants intervention. We respectfully request that the Council takes urgent action to ensure the site is cleared, secured, and brought back into a reasonable condition. We look forward to your prompt response and to seeing decisive steps taken to resolve this ongoing issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blandford Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
